programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville get to grips with the tricky problem of compostable and biodegradable packaging. Does the labelling really stack up? Angela's got all the answers. Also, the delivery companies letting down disabled customers. Will the authorities deliver the crackdown they've promised? And Gloria and Julia are in the advice clinic, where top experts are on duty to solve your consumer problems.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback S3 (9/10)
programme.desc: Data captured by mobile phone masts helps bring a pair of prolific burglars to justice.

programme.title: Defenders UK S5 (9/10)
programme.desc: A trader is caught selling chocolate bars that put children's health at risk.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S26 (26/30)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Birkenhead, Ramsgate and Hull.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley heads to Shrewsbury in Shropshire, where experts Thomas Forrester and Mark Stacey guide the red and blue teams as they go in search of some bargains before selling them at auction in Lichfield. Caroline visits RAF Cosford to learn about a team of Spitfire-flying women.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Doctors (Starting Fires) S24 (n°70)
programme.desc: «Starting Fires»Jimmi's patient Jay takes a chance on a new relationship, but things go from bad to worse.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S14 (6/20)
programme.desc: The team upcycle a chest of drawers, some utility chairs and a set of trestle table bases.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S22 (42/55)
programme.desc: A creative couple from London want to swap city life for adventures in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman and Angellica Bell join us from the RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2023. Angellica chats to YouTube and Strictly star Joe Sugg about his new-found passion for gardening, and James Wong gives us his beginners' guide to growing houseplants. Toby Buckland shares his ideas on how to bring the outer edges of your garden to life, while Nicki joins Rachel in creating a show-stopping look for your front door. Mark Lane reveals his top tips to get all-year-round interest from your plants.

programme.title: The Repair Shop S9
programme.desc: The King and HM the Queen's other children holding vigil around the coffin of Her Majesty.

programme.title: Pointless S28
programme.desc: The brainy quiz returns - but this time host Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Stephen Mangan. As always, contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders (n°6704)
programme.desc: Ben goes to drastic measures to help Lola. Stacey comes up with a plan to help her family.

programme.title: MasterChef S19
programme.desc: The seven remaining amateurs have to cook a dish that is 'so wrong that it's right'.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars S2 (8/8)
programme.desc: It's the final. Who will be Gordon's Future Food Star?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents Question Time with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from an audience in different parts of the UK each week. Also live on iPlayer at 20:00.

programme.title: Newscast S4
programme.desc: Lighthearted discussion of the week's political events.
